intro: Chrysocephalum apiculatum subsp. caespitosum, commonly known as the golden everlasting or caespitosum everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is well adapted to dry, sunny conditions and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
